runs.comm: width and a hint of late swing, but it's a half-volley length and slapped violently through point. Useful start for New Zealand ...
better. Outside off and through to the keeper
tighter line, nipping back into the left-hander. Defended on off stump
short, too short, Mustard takes down the leg side as Ryder misses out on a pull
full length, angled towards leg stump and turned to midwicket
right up in the blockhole, McCullum drives but can't beat mid-off. Good finish to the over
clipped off the toes, picked up at backward square
in the slot for the drive, outside off and bending back onto the middle of the bat. But mid-off intercepts
too wide, and Ryder cashes in again. England are learning a bit about his strengths now, and that slashing drive is one of them
massive appeal, but a touch ambitious. Angling down leg, and an inside-edge as well
on the toes, whipped away with a flourish, fielded at deep square leg
outside off, shaping away from the right-hander, who leaves alone
short, and bouncing into a scything cut. Sidebottom does well to field on the third-man boundary
driven into space in the covers
clubbed into the covers again, but intercepted

a bit of width and Ryder is aiming too straight. This one is swung high into the air, three men converge on it in the covers, and Shah it is who clings on with outstretched hands. That's the breakthrough
on the hips, and nudged away
full length, shaping back into the right-hander, pushed carefully to mid-off
good-length inswinger, worked square with a clip off the toes
driven into the covers
pushed down the ground again, but this is a tight over
full toss, but Taylor can't cash in. Midwicket picks up a scything pull
outside off, a low full-toss, but that's inside-edged onto the stumps, and now New Zealand are in a lot of trouble. They needed their captain to go big, but he's gone now
turned off the hips with a closed face
full length, speared into the toes, clipped firmly but without great placement to midwicket
average cricket all round there. A wild full toss, an ugly edged smear, and a loss of concentration from Collingwood at slip who fumbles his take
that's travelled many a mile! Right in the slot for Taylor, who swings effortlessly over cow corner and all the way into the stands
exaggerated forward defensive
cracking shot, Anderson serves up a slower ball, and Taylor responds with a bullet-like slog-sweep that pierces the leg-side field, all along the ground as well
nice start, outswinger, outside off stump and bending around the edge of a tentative drive
short, and swung away into no-man's land at midwicket. Safe enough
outside off, and a thumping cut bobbles down into the crease, as Mustard rushes up to field
massive! That's the biggest six of the night by a distance, and sails into the advertising hoardings below the top tier of the grandstand. Lovely strike
that's the way to respond. A slower ball, wider as well, Taylor is looking to hit leg-side again, but instead scoops a simple chance to Ian Bell, running back in the covers
good length to finish the over, defended on off stump
angled down the leg side, raps the pad but never close enough to justify the appeal
leg side again, worked off the toes
finds the gap, but New Zealand need more than singles
pushed into the covers, and a quick single ensues
more tip-and-run, another one notched off
outside off. An eager slash, but Mustard takes well
that's a good start, looped onto a good length, and pushed back down the pitch
teasing pace and length, fielded at mid-on
cracking strike, not a lot wrong with the ball, but How was into position early, and his sweep perfectly bisected the two leg-side fielders
defended this time
another well-timed sweep, but straight to deep square leg this time
attempted nurdle off the back foot, no power behind the shot but finds the gap nonetheless
driven airily into the covers, but bounces short of the fielder
pulled into space at midwicket
checked drive, into the covers
what a strike! That sweep is proving profitable, although this was more of a well-timed flick, into the gap at square leg, and all the way over the rope
on a good length, and driven uppishly through the covers
back of a length, and that's a genuine outside edge. Mascarenhas throws his hands up in disgust, but Mustard can't cut that off
outside off, and no timing on an attempted pull
short, Styris tries to pull but the ball gets big on him, and very nearly carries all the way back to a diving Broad in his followthrough
shovelled into the covers, picked up at mid-off
into position for the drive, but cut off in the covers again
Styris makes room early, but Broad spots him going and bangs in short. A toe-ended cut rolls out to deep point
full length and clipped into the leg side
flicked to midwicket
wide, he slashes but gets a thick edge and Sidebottom at deepish backward point holds a routine catch
a push and a miss
weak push-drive back to Mascarenhas who fields to his right
gently driven to long-on
swings across the line, a roared appeal and a leg bye. it hit him just outside the line of off stump, a good call from Billy B
wristy flick to deep midwicket
inside-out drive skims inches wide of extra cover, long-off has to move smartly round but cannot prevent the two
a really limp reverse sweep barely gets off the cut strip
swept to deep square leg
another sweep but no real power and it's catching practice for Anderson at deep square leg
flicked past midwicket who should have done better
dropped a swing and top edge goes high into the night sky, Sidebottom hurtles in from the backward point boundary, dives full length but just fails to cling on
misses one outside off stump
leans back and really thumps that through the covers, it fizzes across the turf
he shuffles to the off and loses his leg stump
pushed defensively into the off side
again little more than a defensive poke into the covers
completely bottom-handed flick into the leg side
half volley thumped a long way into the stand behind midwicket ... a small ground but that was six anywhere you care to mention
driven to the left of a diving Swann
driven to deep cover, Wright takes a routine catch at the third attempt and then grins sheepishly
flicked to deep midwicket
attempts a steer to third man but misses one that turns not a jot
steps back and flat bats the ball high over Billy Bowden who gets another excuse to take centre stage. As if he needs one
steps to leg, Broad goes down the off side and the swing is nowhere near it
a swing and a miss
short outside off stump, another swing misses by some way but it's a no-ball as tit's the second bouncer of the over
inswinging yorker, not dug out to much as slogged out, a thick inside edge into the pads and the ball dribbles into the off side
much slower one deceives Hitchcock who realises he has been done early and pulls out of the shot
early on an attempted pull, the ball cannons into the covers off his pads
full toss driven straight down the ground but not with enough power to beats the outfielders
pushed through extra cover
one-kneed swing-drive past Swann
swung over midwicket but that area is well guarded in the deep
opens the face and drives square through the covers
heaved along the ground to deep midwicket
he steps to leg and launches the ball for six over cover. Broad looks bemused but it was a super shot. Only five more of those this over and we might have a game
slower ball, he gets in a muddle and the ball dribbles to Mustard
short and wide, he toe-ends the ball behind square on the off
nurdled with little power to midwicket
lovely footwork, he shimmied to leg and drove the ball through extra cover
undone by a change of pace and much too early with an intended pull
a big stride to leg but Sidebottom fires in a yorker-length delivery two feet outside off and there's no way he can get a bat on that
another yorker, this time straight, Mills again gives himself room and manages to squirt the ball to backward point
full and straight, a swing across the line, a miss and an uprooted middle stump
driven to mid-off who has come up for the tailender
full and down the leg side. had he stood where he was it would have been a wide, as it was it passed between batsman and stumps and Mustard made a tidy stop
he follows the batsman who can get no power into the shot and Sidebottom fields
inside edge beats a diving Mustard. It was down the leg but the batsman had moved way outside the line to play it
he's going to be treading on square-leg's toes if he moves any more to the on side ... Anderson follows and cramps him up
a swipe over midwicket from a yard outside leg
way down the leg side -  about five feet - but he was only following where the batsman was heading, Mustard takes a low one that scoots through to him
clipped off his pads from a yard outside leg to the square boundary which is unprotected
finally Anderson aims for the stumps and that allows Southee to free his arms and drive square on the off side
turned to backward square leg who is on the edge of the circle
driven to deep cover
squeezed to third man
driven to extra cover
full and at his feet, patted to extra cover
full and straight, Mascarenhas at extra cover could have got there and would have had the match been on the line, as it is he allows the ball to bumble to long-off
